list_definition.definition: of soldiers or armed forces generally, or war

list_ex_of_english: However, the failure of the military's coup attempt in 1991 and the attempt to wrest power in 1992 meant that new avenues for political legitimacy had to be found.
Perhaps most importantly, the level of political and military disruption was a crucial determinant of economic health in both macroregions.
Political intrusion compounded the military's woes.
The para-militaries also had a lot to do with it.
In the pirates' case, their assets included military expertise and integration into long-distance commercial networks.
Her assessment of the growing tensions with the army, especially around the military's control and misuse of international assistance following the earthquake of 1976 is also informative.
Their manpower was limited and their military equipment negligible.
Their response to criticism of the military's record on human rights is to point to the improved openness and transparency.
